verses.kjv: Masters, give unto your servants that which is just and equal; knowing that ye also have a Master in heaven.
verses.ct: Masters, treat your servants with justice and fairness, remembering that you also have a Master in heaven.

verses.kjv: Continue in prayer, and watch in the same with thanksgiving;
verses.ct: Be devoted to prayer, staying alert in it with a thankful attitude.

verses.kjv: Withal praying also for us, that God would open unto us a door of utterance, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in bonds:
verses.ct: At the same time, pray for us too, that God would give us an opportunity to share the message — the mystery of Christ — which is the very reason I'm in chains.

verses.kjv: That I may make it manifest, as I ought to speak.
verses.ct: Pray that I would communicate it clearly, the way I'm supposed to.

verses.kjv: Walk in wisdom toward them that are without, redeeming the time.
verses.ct: Act wisely around outsiders, making the most of every opportunity.

verses.kjv: Let your speech be alway with grace, seasoned with salt, that ye may know how ye ought to answer every man.
verses.ct: Your conversation should always be full of grace, flavored with wit, so that you know how to respond to each person appropriately.

verses.kjv: All my state shall Tychicus declare unto you, who is a beloved brother, and a faithful minister and fellowservant in the Lord:
verses.ct: Tychicus will tell you everything about how I'm doing. He is a dear brother, a trustworthy servant, and a fellow worker in the Lord.

verses.kjv: Whom I have sent unto you for the same purpose, that he might know your estate, and comfort your hearts;
verses.ct: I'm sending him to you for this exact reason — so he can learn how you're doing and encourage your hearts.

verses.kjv: With Onesimus, a faithful and beloved brother, who is one of you. They shall make known unto you all things which are done here.
verses.ct: He's coming along with Onesimus, a faithful and dear brother who is one of your own. Together they will fill you in on everything happening here.

verses.kjv: Aristarchus my fellowprisoner saluteth you, and Marcus, sister’s son to Barnabas, (touching whom ye received commandments: if he come unto you, receive him;)
verses.ct: Aristarchus, my fellow prisoner, sends his greetings to you, and so does Mark, the cousin of Barnabas. (You've already received instructions about him — if he visits you, welcome him.)

verses.kjv: And Jesus, which is called Justus, who are of the circumcision. These only are my fellowworkers unto the kingdom of God, which have been a comfort unto me.
verses.ct: Jesus, who goes by Justus, also sends greetings. These are the only Jewish believers working with me for the kingdom of God, and they have been a real encouragement to me.

verses.kjv: Epaphras, who is one of you, a servant of Christ, saluteth you, always labouring fervently for you in prayers, that ye may stand perfect and complete in all the will of God.
verses.ct: Epaphras, who is one of your own and a servant of Christ, sends his greetings. He is always wrestling in prayer on your behalf, asking that you would stand firm, mature and fully assured in everything God wants for you.

verses.kjv: For I bear him record, that he hath a great zeal for you, and them that are in Laodicea, and them in Hierapolis.
verses.ct: I can personally vouch for him — he works incredibly hard for you, and for those in Laodicea and Hierapolis.

verses.kjv: Luke, the beloved physician, and Demas, greet you.
verses.ct: Luke, the dear doctor, and Demas send you their greetings.

verses.kjv: Salute the brethren which are in Laodicea, and Nymphas, and the church which is in his house.
verses.ct: Give my greetings to the brothers and sisters in Laodicea, and to Nymphas and the church that meets in his house.

verses.kjv: And when this epistle is read among you, cause that it be read also in the church of the Laodiceans; and that ye likewise read the epistle from Laodicea.
verses.ct: After this letter has been read among you, make sure it gets read in the church at Laodicea as well. And you should also read the letter coming from Laodicea.

verses.kjv: And say to Archippus, Take heed to the ministry which thou hast received in the Lord, that thou fulfil it.
verses.ct: Tell Archippus, 'Make sure you complete the ministry that you received in the Lord.'

verses.kjv: The salutation by the hand of me Paul. Remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.
verses.ct: I, Paul, am writing this greeting with my own hand. Remember that I am in chains. May grace be with you. Amen.
